context.p: A deployment type within the Capacity Planner is intended to be a representation of a variations such as 30K, 5K etc. It refers to some presets of the different resource requirements for various different types of deployment.
Create a new deployment type for the Capacity Planner

info.p: Click the deployment type view from the nav bar at the top.
Click the Create new deployment type button
Enter the details in the fields.
NOTE: Restrictions on the fields are as follows:

ul.li: CPU, Memory, Cinder Storage and IOPS and ENFS Storage and IOPS must all be positive integers

info.p: Click the Save button and you will be redirected back to the previous page where you can see the newly created deployment type with new options to edit and delete that deployment type.
NOTE: Deployment Type will not save if any fields are invalid (RED in UI)

result.p: A New Deployment Type is created in the Capacity Planner.
